description: Borrowed from Dutch sloep. Doublet of chalupa and shallop.

entries.meaning: (nautical) A single-masted sailboat with only one headsail.
examples: I stayed in this island for a few days; I believe it could not be above a fortnight; when I and some few more slaves, that were not saleable amongst the rest, from very much fretting, were shipped off in a sloop for North America.

entries.meaning: (military) A sailing warship, smaller than a frigate, with its guns all on one deck.
(military) A sloop-of-war, smaller than a frigate, larger than a corvette.
